Common.Highlight.Common.Text: Dense, in-fill area with high barriers to entry
Proximity to the Illinois Medical District (IMD)

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
The immediate area has seen numerous retail developments over the past several years and proposed for the near future. Signiﬁ cant developments that have occurred within the past ﬁ ve years and in close proximity of the property include the United Center’s 190,000 SF addition, Chicago Bulls 60,900 SF practice facility, The School of Health Sciences-Malcolm X College totaling 545,000 SF and Chicago Blackhawks 125,000 SF MB Ice Arena. These recent projects have added a plethora of jobs as well as residents to the area. The Chicago Bulls addition and practice facility has contributed over 500 jobs within the immediate area and the Blackhawks new two-rink facility has added an additional 1,000 jobs to the neighborhood. Enrollments at Malcolm X College has nearly doubled in the past few years for a total student population of 6,183.

In addition, the Randolph/Fulton Market area, a mere four blocks from the property, has emerged as a cutting-edge dining and entertainment destination. In the last ﬁve years, a revitalization to the already popular “restaurant row” added cutting edge restaurants from nationally acclaimed chefs. Also, new boutique hotels like Soho House, Ace Hotel and the Hoxton have recently opened, with the new Nobu Hotel nearing its completion. 

A few blocks south of the property is a new mixed-use town center development called, The Gateway. The project will spread over 10-acres and bring a range of amenities and facilities to the Illinois Medical District and Chicago’s greater West Side. The Gateway will feature nine projects, totaling 1,260,000 SF of mixed-use space. There will be three hotels on-site, a 240-room dual brand Hilton hotel, 136-room Hampton Inn and 104-room Homewood Suites. In addition, there will be a 220 unit apartment building and a 550,000 sf ofﬁce building. There will be a grand total of 85,000 SF of retail space throughout the project, oriented towards food and services.  Lastly, Rush Hospital plans to develop the Rush Center for Advanced Healthcare, which begins construction in 2019 and has an expected completion date of 2022. The center piece of the project features an 11-story, 530,000 SF building with 1,200 parking spaces.

Illinois Medical District (IMD)
The property beneﬁts from its location amongst some of the most afﬂuent, densely populated and highest generating business districts in Chicago. The Illinois Medical District (IMD), consists of 560 acres of medical research facilities, labs, a biotechnology business incubator, four major hospitals, two medical universities, and more than 40 healthcare related facilities. This district is constantly growing and doubling in size, leading to the development of both ofﬁce and residential buildings on the near West side of Chicago. As mentioned before, the IMD is currently constructing major new developments such as “The Gateway”, a $473M  expansion to their facility.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: CBRE, as exclusive agent, is pleased to announce the opportunity to acquire 2033 W Madison Street, a prime 16,560 SF corner lot located just west of downtown Chicago and the rapidly expanding Fulton Market District. The property site boasts generous zoning and easy access to the Eisenhower Expressway.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Located in the O’Hare submarket, 8201 Higgins provides an opportunity to lease, build to suit, or purchase. The approximately 3 acre site is situated along
I-90 and is only 2.5 miles from O’Hare International Airport, where the city of Chicago meets the suburbs. Its proximity to public transportation and driver friendly
location provides unparalleled branding opportunities for corporate headquarters or retail.
